DOC.detailed_description: A post-market , single-center , prospective , randomize , single-blinded study . Each subject serve her/his control . The procedure choose bilateral , subject one side surgical site treat MIST Therapy side leave untreated except surgeon 's usual postoperative care protocol . Study objective : Comparison MIST-treated side versus contralateral untreated side reduction swelling , bruising , firmness , pain , wound heal complication ; potential improvement scar ; improvement patient satisfaction . Subject recruitment : A total 30 subject enrol study . The MIST-treated side randomly assign . The assigned MIST-treated side know subject assistant provide MIST Therapy , know Investigator/assessor . Protocol procedure : Subjects follow 12 week post-surgery . The side assign MIST Therapy treatment treat weekly , begin 2-3 day post-surgery , continue 3 week post-surgery . A baseline evaluation include demographic data , medical surgical history , smoke history , laboratory test , digital photography side wound . Subjects assess follow timepoints post-surgery : Days 2,7,14 , 21 , 28 , 42 84 . The following procedure assessment obtain specific timepoints : - MIST Therapy treatment assign wound side ( Days 2 , 7 , 14 , 21 ) - Digital photograph ( Baseline , Days 14 , 21 , 42 , 84 ) - Bruising assessment ( Days 7 14 ) - Pain assessment ( Days 7 14 ) - Swelling assessment ( Days 7 14 ) - Firmness assessment ( Days 21 42 ) - Scar assessment ( Days 21 84 ) - Subject satisfaction ( Day 84 ) - Concomitant treatment include use moisturizers , scar cream compression garment ( timepoints ) - Wound heal complication assessment ( timepoints ) - Adverse event assessment ( timepoints follow informed consent )
